summary:
## The Fall of Constantinople

On May 29, 1453, the Ottoman Empire conquered Constantinople, the capital of the Byzantine Empire. The young Sultan Mehmed II led a huge army that outnumbered the Byzantine defenders, who were commanded by Emperor Constantine XI.

This victory marked the end of the Roman Empire, which had lasted almost 1500 years. It also changed military history by showing the power of gunpowder and cannons, which could destroy even the strong Theodosian Walls that had protected the city for centuries.
title: Fall of Constantinople
